Reviews.Title: “Good motel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SnowWhiteOnWhiteWine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights in March and were very happy with this hotel. The staff at reception were very friendly as was the owner. The room was comfortable and very clean. There was a good fridge, microwave oven and coffee maker. The coffee/tea/sugar were replenished each day. The room was cleaned each day and towels/ sheets were changed each day . There was complimentary breakfast which consisted of cakes and you made your own coffee in the room. There was a lift. Although the hotel is on a main road we had a room near the back and so the traffic did not bother us. It was easy to get buses to Fisherman's Wharf and other parts of San Francisco. There was a bicycle rental shop three or four blocks away which we used on two occasions. The hotel is also very close to Cow Hollow where there are lots of restaurants. If we go to San Francisco again I would be quite happy to stay here again. It is a motel but it was comfortable and had all that we required.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pat M
Reviews.Content: Our friend who used to live in San Francisco recommended the Redwood Inn, otherwise, we probably would not have found this gem. We called the day we were arriving, which was a Friday in mid-April, 2012 and they had rooms available (lucky for us). The rooms are very reasonably priced. One of the aspects that drew us was the free parking, which is great in the middle of San Francisco. We asked for a quiet room and we were not disappointed. Our room was spacious and clean, with a full sized refrigerator! We didn't need it, but had we been staying longer than a night, we would have taken advantage of this. There is an elevator as well as 2 sets of stairs and motel style rooms, which open directly to the outdoor tiered walkways. The free donuts in the lobby were a bonus when I checked out. The only thing that kept me from giving them 5 stars was some confusion around my credit card receipt, but the woman working at the front desk was very kind as she worked through it.

Reviews.Title: “The Price is Right...let's see what's behind door number one!”
Reviews.Author: Munibrokr
Reviews.Content: Recently booked 2 rooms for a long weekend at the Redwood Inn and got more then we bargained for. We got 2 modestly furnished rooms. Also 2 free parking spaces, free donuts, free wifi, a microwave and mini frig......yes, there were reasonably comfortable beds and a decent bathroom as well. There are very few things we did not like or appreciate about the Redwood Inn. Here's a list: The sounds of city traffic piercing the thin exterior window, door and wall (after 1 night, we didn't seem to notice it as much) Management asking for a $50 cash deposit from the members of one of our party for one room, but not the other. (deposit to assure the return of the TV remote control. I guess we fit the remote stealing profile) Requested a microwave in each room and there was only a microwave in one (honestly never used the one we had) Locked gate to the roof (dont know that we would have spent longer then a few minutes anyway...took some pictures and came back down) BIGGEST COMPLIANT Paper thin pillows...you know, the type you have to fold in half so you can at least feel them under your head and only 2 on each queen size bed. This being our biggest compliant and the great price we paid to stay here.....we all gave it a 2 thumbs up!! The good far exceeded the bad. Now understand, if you are looking to impress someone, I would not bring them back to this "motorlodge", but that aside, we enjoyed our stay in this safe, clean accommodation. See picture we posted for more details.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Spils
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel for the price, we stayed 4 nights. Staff were plesant, and Breakfast is provided at Reception in the morning. Get in quick before all the Donuts and Muffins are gone though! Located in Fishermans walk so everything is a bus ride or walking distance ( beware of the hills) away. The rooms were clean and the provided coffee and fridge which was handy. Safeway is a 10 min walk away (always a plus). Other people seem to moan about noise but this did not bother us at all. We got to San Fran on a Friday evening. A few motels were booked out. I looked at 5 motels in the same area in San Fran and all were more expensive than the Redwood so I would definately recomend the Redwood for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: willy1900
Reviews.Content: Best price we found within reasonable walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Staff were all extremely nice and helpful. Internet would not connect. Clean, basic room, small frig and coffee maker in room. Good donuts in office in AM. A little noisy from traffic, but when you're tired......

Reviews.Title: “Good value, close to Lombard & Ghirardelli”
Reviews.Author: MKellogg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights during a trip through the Bay Area to look at colleges for my daughter. I picked it for the good reviews and its proximity to the Wharf, where we enjoy walking at nighttime. It's an easy 6-block walk from the hotel to Ghirardelli Square. Also just up the road (literally) is the top of Lombard Street, the world's windiest road. We stayed in room 38, which is on the 3rd floor directly facing Lombard. There are exterior stairs and an elevator close by. The room was clean enough and had adequate facilities, including a shower/toilet separate from the vanity area; a refrigerator; and a TV. You pay a deposit for room keys and the TV remote. The staff is friendly and always available. When our toilet stopped up they had a guy up to fix it within 5 minutes. They also offer donuts and pastries there at the front desk in the morning, which was nice and unexpected. They have free Wi-fi, not even a password, though it is extremely slow. The fridge makes a loud-ish rattling sound so I unplugged it at night and propped open its door. Also due to its location on Lombard, there is traffic all night long outside and this is fairly noisy. Walls are thin, as expected for a lower-end motel. The morning we checked out, there was no hot water at all, so no showers for us. They said the hot water heater had stopped working for everyone, for some reason. Many places charge for parking but Redwood's is free, and they guarantee you a space; if you come back from somewhere and there are no spaces they say they will take your keys and double-park you in the lot until a space opens up. They are also close to bus lines in case you like using transit to get around. Our stay was okay, and for $110 in that location we felt it was a good deal, outside of the hot water problem.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: Maya_on_tour
Reviews.Content: Free parking, WiFi, nice staff, good location. We stayed there three nights in march. The room was a little bit smelly, there was a whole kitschen in the room, but we didn't use it, didn't seem really clean to me. The refrigerator was very loud so I unplugged it during our stay. The location ist nice, easy walk to fisherman warf - there is also a bus stop around the corner. No booking over the internet was a little bit strange first, since I didn't get an answer of me e-mail request, i phoned to book the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good...”
Reviews.Author: Supervetty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend and it was a pretty clean and good hotel. Only thing they don't mention until you get there is about the $50 dollar deposit. But other than that the hotel is a pretty good deal compared to the other hotels in San Fran. We walked around everywhere, Chinatown is pretty close by as well. I recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “Redwood Inn”
Reviews.Author: ejain
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price for this location. The room are a bit dated, but otherwise fine. Free parking and wireless Internet. The staff was very helpful, too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Morning_blossom
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 3 nights. The location is good although we took a car to see most of the places in SF anyways. The room was just ok, old furniture and bad smell when we walked in. We kept the window open all the time to get some fresh air. They serve doughnuts for breakfast but honestly skip it and go to some other place for breakfast. SF has awesome food, try it. The hotel was really nothing special, it is more like a motel or even a hostel. It is definitely for people who are in SF because they want to tour the city and don't care so much about place to stay. One night there were drunk people outside and we could not sleep, they were so loud. But I guess it can happen anywhere. The price is very good. We got $80/night and we spend extra money that we saved by not picking more expensive place on great food. Do the same, it is wort it!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, lovely staff, good value, older style”
Reviews.Author: bangforbucktravel
Reviews.Content: My title pretty much sums it up. My partner and I stayed here a total of 5 nights on our recent US holiday. The rooms are an older style, very 80's feel with green carpet. But if you're sightseeing all day anyway it's a decent place to rest. My only issue would be the hot water. We traveled in winter so a nice hot shower was pretty important to us. Unfortunately it was a bit lacking. We were on the 4th floor so can't speak for other floors. But the water would take ages to warm up, but while showering it would go slightly cold. Apart from this, well cleaned, decent value and great location. Must visit Mel's Diner which is down the road about a 5-10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Parking is a real plus”
Reviews.Author: OceanAdvocate
Reviews.Content: It's just a motel on a very busy street, but it's well tended by cheerful staff and the location, reasonable room rate, and free parking combine to make it a worthy option. Our room was clean and included a fridge and microwave, which we really appreciated. It's an easy walk to Chestnut Street, Union Street, and Polk Street -- three lively neighborhoods with lots of coffee houses & good restaurants frequented by locals & visitors. And, of course, it's also just a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf and the crooked street block of Lombard, if you want to take in some prime tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “priced to high”
Reviews.Author: kleeottorogers
Reviews.Content: We were told that we could not get the advertised rate of $80 per night because of a convention and Chinese parade, but that was just for one night, Saturday, Sunday the price should have dropped to the normal rate, but the front desk person would not budge at all, I was charged $120 per night, way to much Pluses here are that there is onsite parking, which we understand is a good thing in San Fran, service was otherwise good (except we were over charged) I would recommend this place as long as you get the advertised price of $80 for 1 queen bed for 2 people, this place is in need of a total renovation, it is 40 years outdated, green appliances, old style cheap TV's, but a very good location near Downtown San Fran

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Dan M
Reviews.Content: After a 4 day stay I can agree with what most people say about this no frills hotel. The rooms are clean, neat and well maintained. Bed was hard, pillows not very thick. A good value considering everything in the wharf area was about twice as much. It is centrally located - close enough to the Wharf, public transportation, and easy access to Golden Gate Bridge, Muir Woods, and Napa Valley. We did not use public transortation - rented a car. For us that was a good decision - negotiating the streets was typical of city streets - not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “can't do much better in sf”
Reviews.Author: sarab212121
Reviews.Content: great location, friendly and helpful staff, free parking, free internet, great view of the golden gate bridge from the roof top stairs,easy walk to multiple great neighborhoods, we will stay here again and again

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Mohawk1975
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly and willing to help when required. The rooms are basic but generally clean. The location is on Lombard Street so practically central to everything you would want to see in SF. This is not the Ritz, but if you're looking for a central location and decent accommodation in a major city - I would not hesitate to use the Redwood Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Laurajoshb
Reviews.Content: We will rave about Redwood Inn for a long time. The inn is perfectly located for walks to: Fishermans Wharf, Alcatraz pier, amazing food on Union & surrounding streets, to bike hire for the day, to the cable car & public transport options to the Mission District, Union Sq & all the cool San Fran hang outs. The inn itself in terms of price is the cheapest in the area by far, it is spacious, comfortable, bright w a large window, small kitchenette in our room, a coffee pot that we used every single morning, the bed is large & comfy, the heater & all amenities work well. We loved the inn keepers, they are helpful & very knowledgeable about the area & were always smiling when we walked in, asking for another nights stay ( we booked for two nights, then loved SF so much we stayed 6 ) Major plus: amazing donuts & muffins for breakfast every morning!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Exploring San Francisco and Bay Area.”
Reviews.Author: hbhansen
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of visiting San Francisco over New Year’s Eve. The choice ended on Redwood Inn as the place to stay. I had to phone them to make the reservation; compared to how easy available online booking is today it was odd. The Rates where great, also the special rate over NYE, with everything booked we left for San Francisco. Upon arrival we were meet friendly and with open arms, we felt expected and everything was in order, did the paper work and went to the room. The Room was very clean and good condition. Bed was comfy and everything had its place, towels were on a rack and toilet was clean and inviting. Toilet flusher was broken, but you could flush it manually so we decided to notify the front office in the morning and started out on the adventures of San Francisco. The toilet was fixed when we got back to the room, and everything was now in order. Also the cleaning had been executed and very though. The Redwood Inn is perfect if you want to stay fairly cheap. With free accessible parking its perfect for a place to stay and explore San Francisco. It’s close to Fisherman’s Warf, lots of good restaurants on Lombard St, Chestnut St, and Union St. You can walk to the Marina and see Golden Gate Bridge. Just make it up 3 blocks of Lombard St. (steep) and you have access to the Cable Car for Downtown. Only negative thing to mention is that sound travels well in the rooms, Lombard St. is a busy Street, you can hear that, as well as other neighbors of the Redwood Inn. All in all a great bargain, we were most pleased with our stay for almost 2 weeks. I would recommend to stay here if you wanted to visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good staing and service”
Reviews.Author: RavidSegal
Reviews.Content: The place was in good location, clean. Very nice helpful people. Free parking. For the price it's recomend Price was 90 per n.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mptopham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple for 2 nights in December 2011 in a top floor room towards the back of the hotel. Pros: Staff were very friendly and knowledgeable of the area Good location, could walk to most places and good bars and restaurants nearby Room was very clean Excellent value for money Good sized room with all amenities, cable tv, fridge, air con etc Comfortable bed and bedding Cons: Lights outside rooms were left on all night and were very bright Could be noisy near the front of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “i would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erin S
Reviews.Content: this hotel made was creepy and dirty. we didnt want to lay on the sheets or bedspread. the only good thing was the location. would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and cheap - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Bobby K
Reviews.Content: Me and 3 of my fellow travellers stayed here during our week long stay in San Francisco, it has a fantastic location, was cheap, clean and the staff were very helpful - all we could ask for!

Reviews.Title: “"Good location and clean"”
Reviews.Author: Winton S
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, the rooms were clean...nothing fancy but had all we needed. Location was close to tour bus pick-up, fisherman's wharf and cable cars. The front desk folks were friendly and helpful. Fairly quiet for street noise as it is located on Lombard St. Had supper at Cafe Lombard up the street, food was good. Reasonably priced and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ChezWhitten
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our trip to San Francisco. The Management of the Redwood Inn were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and tidy every day and the price was reasonable. We were within walking distance of many of the tourist sites and a small grocery store where we could pick up food for supper when we didn't feel like going out after a long day of touring the city. We would stay at the Redwood Inn again. V&G

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: clare g
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and stayed here for 3 nights. We took 2 rooms with queen beds. The rooms are a bit dated but the location was great, 15 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf and the hop-on bus stopped right next to the hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. My friend came to meet us for dinner and they let him leave his car in the hotel parking lot which was very nice of them. There was never a problem with parking but the nice gentleman at reception assured us that if we had a problem, they would valet park for us.Doughnuts and muffins are served in the reception area every morning. There are laundry facilities in the parking lot. You can hear the noise from the street but I think that could be said about any centrally located hotel in SF. Only bath gel is provided, I think the hotel could also provide shampoo and conditioner. Eat at Lttle Delhi, the best Indian restaurant we ever ate at and Modern Thai for excellent Thai food.

Reviews.Title: “Redwood Inn”
Reviews.Author: Jesse H
Reviews.Content: We only stay at the Redwood inn on Lombard st when we visit San Francisco,A great staff,Clean and comfortable rooms, walking distance to any worth seeing in the city,and a good value for your money..

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but not much more”
Reviews.Author: ynp-CV
Reviews.Content: Very small room, but it had a microwave and fridge. Bed was litterally like a slab of granite. Bedspread was very worn and had blood stains--threw it on the floor immediately. Heater was digital and worked well and was quiet. Bathroom was very small and the limited towels were almost tissue paper thin. Don't ever take Room #10, it faces Lombard and the road noise is going all night long. Remotes are given out at the front desk and it has a million buttons and is hard to figure out. TV does have loads of channels. Parking is free, but the small lot is very tight to maneuver in and the employees take up some of the spaces--don't bring your big SUV!! Front desk staff is friendly, but both breakfast places they directed me to were closed at 8 AM and not open yet. Breakfast is a tray of pastries that they pick for you, nothing to drink. Stay here if you like, you'll get basically what you pay for, but I much prefer the Cow Hollow, Coventry, or Chelsea along Lombard with much bigger free parking lots.

Reviews.Title: “2danes”
Reviews.Author: twodanes_CPH
Reviews.Content: Value for money hotel. Helpful and friendly staff. Clean and comfortable facilities. Perfectly situated - you can walk to the Wharf in 15 minutes and downtown in half an hour. Originally we wanted to stay 5 days - but ended staying 12. A bit noise from the street - but that´s a part of staying in a large city. Our room had a big fridge - so the cool drinks were not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: 2coyotes
Reviews.Content: Hosts were awsome upon check in. Took our luggage up to the room, offered directions to various places,gave us a map etc. Room was spacious and clean. A little noisy, but is right on Lombard st and this is a big city! Walking distance to Fisherman's wharf and other areas. Great price, FREE parking.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed and relaxed here!”
Reviews.Author: conyza
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really recommendable! The staff and boss are extraordinary friendly and helpful. We stayed 2 nights and enjoyed our stay. We had two big queen size beds, every day new linen and towels. The room was very clean, had a lot of space, equipped with a fridge, a coffee machine and TV. The internet (Wifi) is fast and working well in the rooms! It is a good location to walk to the city. Number 30 Muni-bus is just around the corner if you do not want to walk. The car is safe and they have an open space for high altitude cars like ours (8 feet high or higher). Every time recommendable if you are looking for a hotel downtown on Lombard street. The famous Lombard street part just a few blocks away! Jasmin, Bernhard and Felix

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel: clean, reasonably priced, excellent owners”
Reviews.Author: qt22x
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days then again for one more night on our trip home. The owners were so friendly and helpful far more than one could expect from a motel. Our room was very clean and we had fresh linens everyday. it was just a few minutes walk from FIsherman's wharf and one can easily catch the bus downtown in 15mins.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service EVER”
Reviews.Author: Kathy V
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old son & I stayed here for 4 nights on our first trip to San Francisco. Great location & one of the most prompt & clean motels I have stayed at. Every day we left the room to go sightseeing & upon our return, the room was spotless. They made the beds, vacuumed, refilled ALL coffee, creamer, cups, soaps, etc. Free donuts in the morning was nice too. Our room had a mini-fridge & microwave. I will definitely stay here again. The motel was quiet & I slept good. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! I am so glad we stayed here rather than a hotel downtown (which seemed a lot rougher kind of area). Be careful if you are visiting SF for the first time, there are some very undesirable areas downtown. Stay at this motel & walk or catch the cable car which is 10 minutes away at Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “All perfect”
Reviews.Author: matthieuE2
Reviews.Content: Greatest hotel. Best prices. Everything perfect. not in center but idealy situed

Reviews.Title: “Great staffe!”
Reviews.Author: dyenno
Reviews.Content: great hotel with very nice people it makes you like at home next time i go to SF i will repeat the redwood inn thanks for everything. Dyenno and folks, Natal, RN, Brazil.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT AND FRIENDLY CUSTOMER SERVICE!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathyzee
Reviews.Content: Came from the Los Angeles area and Stayed here for two nights. The staff was absolutely fantastic and very friendly. Front service desk was always on top of everything and extremely resourceful!! A++

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: Apaillettes
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my husband for 3 nights. Ideally located in Lombard Street not far away from some bus stops.The owners were very kind with us and helped us with directions and points of interest. The room was clean and with the right size. We will surely stay there again if we come back to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Very slick in the heart of Silicon Valley”
Reviews.Author: GAKill
Reviews.Content: 2 years old. Clean and sophisticated styling - very light and spacious. Conference room and break area very good with easy access to outside terrace. Large scale business meeting well managed. Lively bar etc in which you might see some of the A-listers. Rooms in separate buildings in the extensive grounds which makes the hotel seem resort-like. Very good gym. Fantastic big shower in the room - one of the few hotels that I have stayed in where you can start the shower without getting even a hand/arm wet.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but great neighborhood and staff”
Reviews.Author: lefty_lucy
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Redwood Inn and felt it was a good value. Pros: nice location, close to Cow Hollow, Marina area, Fort Mason and the wharves. Central to lots of public transportation, but I ended up not using it as there were so many great restaurants and places to see w/in walking distance. The in room kitchenette was great, there are lots of markets to pick up food and reheat in the room that it saved $$ that would be spent going out. The staff was really nice, they made me feel at home. Cons: Being on Lombard it is somewhat noisy, but I never travel w/o earplugs so it was no big deal. Room is very basic, so bring your own shampoo etc. Overall, the pros make up for the cons.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this place”
Reviews.Author: bobanne46
Reviews.Content: The management team here( husband& wife) were incredable, they went out of there way to make our stay in San Fran a memorial one helping us to find the nicest and afforable eateries, where and where not to go,and WE could not fault them. Go to the Italian and Chiness they recommend, they even put on doenuts and patiseries on a morning, GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “Top service and good value for SF”
Reviews.Author: Optimuswolf
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Redwood, as a base for our time in SF. The location is pretty good, and to be honest nowhere is perfect because the sights worth seeing are spread out. Buses were easy to catch and the map the hotel gives you with their routes was very useful. The room was as advertised, fairly basic but with HBO (a rarity on our trip), and good sized clean rooms there was nothing to complain about. The service offered by the husband and wife operators was great, and they generously provided donuts for breakfast. This was enough for us given all the other food we were eating!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: johnzNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: At $100 a night with free parking, this motel is a great value. Staff is friendly and attentive, fresh donuts in the morning. Rooms are small but clean, try to get in the back to reduce road noise. Room had coffee pot, microwave and refrigerator. A little far for most people to walk to Fisherman's Wharf or the Marina, esp. considering the uphill walk back, so although the parking is free you will still have to pay at your destination. Take the money you save and walk around the corner to Bobo's restaurant, a little pricy but the best steaks and grlic crab in town. .

Reviews.Title: “Best value you'll get for your money!”
Reviews.Author: radjan
Reviews.Content: Just been there and it was an amazing stay! The hotel is very close to most of the biggest attractions. The donut served on the morning was the icing on the cake for an amazing time I had in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and clean”
Reviews.Author: pet267
Reviews.Content: This motel was well located near the vibrant Union Street. Free parking and internet are a plus. San Francisco is an expensive place to stay, but Redwood Inn were happy to negotiate on rates. The staff were brusque and the management unfriendly, but they mainly stayed out from under our feet during our four-night stay. We enjoyed being so central and the room had all the basic amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice adequate basic hotel, but get your price first”
Reviews.Author: triptrouble9
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here after other reviews on Tripadvisor and so looked at the hotel website where rooms were advertised for $55 per night (winter season). Rather than book drove to the hotel to check in and was told that the rooms were $85. I queried this re their website and finally managed to get the room for $65. Rooms were basic, clean and comfortable. I agree with another reviewer to ask for a room away from Lombard Street due to the noise. Free Wifi was hit and miss due to the strength of the signal. Nice (10-15 min) walk to Fisherman's Wharf, but along the walk you can get accosted by a number of homeless people. I would not recommend the walk at night to the ladies. Cab was only $6.00 though. On the positive side, a cheap, clean motel that had the basic necessities. On the negative, if they are going to quote a price on their website, they should honour it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal! Excellent Location! ASK FOR A ROOM AWAY FROM LOMBARD STREET, THOUGH!”
Reviews.Author: Cutecaroline
Reviews.Content: I loved this motel! It was basic, clean, and friendly. I've stayed in "fancier" hotels and didn't like them as much. I would definitely come back to the redwood. I mean, hey, they have free doughnuts in the morning -- the true American experience! The room was spacious and clean. The tv was awesome! The bed was comfortable. I only had two problems. Problem one: we were in the room closest to Lombard Street and it was very loud. However, after a few days of walking 20 - 30y kilometers over San Fran's hilly terrain soon made me sleepy the noise was no issue. Problem Two: the laundry machine stopped working one night and I had to take my clothes to a laundrette (of which there are approximately eight billion in San Francisco!) The manager was extremely apologetic and refunded my money so it wasn't a major problem. Everything else was fantatstic!

Reviews.Title: “very basic make sure you get price before you go in writing”
Reviews.Author: lawees
Reviews.Content: this hotel was basic. we never stayed in the room long and glad we didn,t . we had luckily enough our laptop with us wich had the email confirming the price we agreed and the number of people staying if we didn,t we would have to pay more. the wee woman that everyone says is so nice wasn,t so nice when we had the evidence in front of us. the room was very basic , not iron and no laundry facillity . we found a wee beasty in the bed and the carpet was black didn,t trust the coffee maker to make coffee. yes the donuts were great thats all

Reviews.Title: “very good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomandRascal
Reviews.Content: the room was clean, the hotel is in the famous Lombard street. It is about 15 minutes walking from the wharf. the neightborhood is safe and pretty quite at night. There is a refrigerator, a coffee maker and a microwave in the room. They offer very good donuts for breakfast. Free parking!

Reviews.Title: “3 C's : Clean, Comfortable, & Cool n Friendly Lady @ front desk”
Reviews.Author: str8balln
Reviews.Content: Went to Sf for a 3 day weekend getaway. Arrived @ 9am, we see people cleaning, sweeping the floors watering the plants, etc... went away to do our usual tourist thing and came back in the afternoon and they're still cleaning! I think there was no hr of the day that they weren't cleaning hahaha. Front desk was this sweet and nice lady. I think her name was Mae/May? She was so helpful. Gave us a map, pointed out all the tourist spots close to the inn, and answered a lot of questions. Even though I had GPS and i have already mapped out where to go, i still asked her and she happily obliged to answer all of them. Coffee, tea, donuts in the morning. Clean room, bed and free parking. All the usual ammenities with the exception of one thing. They had NO SHAMPOO. Body soap was available though, but who the heck cares for a missing shampoo for the comfort, friendliness, cleanliness and the price you get for this inn. My family loved the stay, and we'll definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Snickerdoddle
Reviews.Content: The front desk was as nice as could be. The room was clean. Don't forget they dont' have an elevator. It is a very long walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Breakfast is one pastry given to you at the front desk. Walk around the corner to the Chestnut Diner for a great breakfast. The room was small but the bedding was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need, nothing you don't”
Reviews.Author: rneff21
Reviews.Content: Go ahead and make a reservation here if you want a good value for your money. The Redwood Inn is a clean and simple option in a very expensive city. There are no hidden fees for parking or internet use either. If you aren't afraid of some moderate walking, the location is great for many of San Francisco's featured attractions. It's an honest establishment ran by friendly people and I'd definitely stay there again in the future. Tasty donuts and muffins in the morning too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service! Great stay! Solid!”
Reviews.Author: Kimura
Reviews.Content: Very good service! Great stay! Solid! Best recommendations!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, but a lot of street noise”
Reviews.Author: kickdiva1
Reviews.Content: I think this motel is a good value for the money. Located right on Lombard street, we paid $110 a night for 2 queen beds, a mircorwave, refrigerator, a small 2 man table, free parking, free wifi, and donuts for breakfast. The managment was very friendly and helpful. The motel is old, but the room was clean as was the whole property. There was an elevator for those who can't take the stairs. We had read about the street noise from other reviews so we asked to be as far away from the road as possible. We were on the top floor at the back of the property but were still able to hear the street noise. What was interesting is that a large family came by making a lot of noise, but the second they closed their door next to us, we did not hear a thing! The city bus stop was a block away, and there were a few restaurants nearby to eat at, not to mention the fact that there were meuns in the front office of restaurants that delivered straight to the motel. For those on a budget who aren't bothered by the sound of cars, this is a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “courtesy and cleanliness way beyond the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: stockbeary
Reviews.Content: I booked this motel because it had good reviews here on trip advisor, low price and free off street parking. I was amazed at the level of service. One of the owners was there at 12:45 am to check us in and help us park our car (there were to many cars for all the slots and the owner was double parking two of the cars and then shuffling them until slots opened up the next morning so everyone could park off street. I have never in my 40 some years of travel experienced this kind of dedication to service). We asked for a quiet room off Lombard (very noisy street) and got one in the back where we couldn't hear any noise at all. The room was not large but had plenty of space to put luggage etc. The room and bath were very clean. Nice sized mini-fridge is included and you can get a microwave if you ask for it. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: MatheusBenevolo
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends stayed in San Francisco just for one night and we had a pleasure experience in this hotel. At first, a friendly and helpful lady checked us in and offered us a pretty nice room with a good price. In the room, it was clean and we also had fridge, wireless internet and a good atmosphere. The hotel has a great location, being just a few blocks of Fisherman's Wharf and for sure, it's a place I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “convenient place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: lovepea
Reviews.Content: The location was great for what we needed. It was a very close walk to the Fort Mason Center, which held the main purpose of our stay. Also convenient to walk to Fisherman's wharf and Ghirardelli square, although you must be in decent shape to walk in San Francisco, with all the hills. The rooms were large, with a nice size fridge. Bathrooms sufficient, with good water pressure. The bed was not very comfortable, but at least it was a clean and safe place to sleep. The staff at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful. They had donuts and pastries for breakfast in the office. Parking was easy and there were plenty of open spaces even when we arrived late at night. Note: take your own toiletries, only a tiny bar of soap is offered. No shampoos or lotions.

Reviews.Title: “confortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: gibri
Reviews.Content: We spend three nights at Redwood Inn. We had a nice, big room, with two comfortable beds. The room as well as the bathroom were very clean. Refrigerator, micowave, coffee maker : nothing missing. A friendly welcome at the reception desk. We just would have appreciated a better insonorisation of the window as the traffic on Lombard Street is heavy. The hotel is at walking distance from the wharf, from the cable car, which is convenient. Also the best doughnuts we had during our three week stay in the US are offered at the reception desk each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean motel but super noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Rylanna
Reviews.Content: The noise from the street is overwhelming! My husband could not sleep. He even tried putting tissue in his ears. The street traffic is so loud that it sounds like they are driving right through your room. I felt that the rooms were overpriced for what you get and although they are AAA approved they do not honor a discount rate. The hot water went from hot to cold constantly when I was taking a shower. The people are nice and the rooms are clean but a far as the price and the noise I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lombard Street Extraordinaire!”
Reviews.Author: Dancingeyes
Reviews.Content: The Redwood Inn is the perfect Lombard motel! The parking spaces were wide enough and long enough to get in and out and made for easy packing and unpacking. The motel in general and our room were hospital clean, without any fragrances or sanitizing odors. We sat at the table for two, slid both windows open, and had a genuine San Francisco view of the hillside neighborhood, covered with multi-million dollar condos. At night, from the roof of the 4-story motel, we saw the Golden Gate Bridge and the Rotunda of The Palace of Fine Arts. This motor inn is family run and Mae and her family saw to it that our every need was met, sometimes they were too attentive, but it made us feel like family. The room was fairly quiet, no noise from the adjoining rooms, but if there were people in the parking area, the noise would echo up to the room. Traffic sounds were noticeable from Lombard Street, but as the night progressed and traffic lessened, so did the street noise. A couple of drawbacks, the room was small, with only a queen bed, refrigerator and coffee pot in it, no microwave in the room, but available in the office. The WiFi connectivity was intermittent and slow. There was a washer and dryer available at a cost of $3 for wash and $3 for dry. The continental breakfast consisted of just muffins and donuts, no coffee or juice. All in all, our experience there was excellent and we will return to the Redwood Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: MrsRon
Reviews.Content: Went up to San Francisco over Easter weekend. This was the least expensive reputable place we could find, and it was a great experience. We arrived late at night, and were immediately impressed with the cleanliness of the lobby and friendliness of the staff. We asked for a microwave and fridge in the room, but when we arrived, there was a full kitchenette (oven and all!). The room was a bit old and dated, but not shabby, and it was thoroughly cleaned and restocked every day. The parking was free, which, in San Francisco, is a HUGE plus! Additionally, there was free wi-fi, although the connection was not very high-speed. The hotel is in a good location. It's maybe two blocks from a bus stop. It's only about four blocks from the "Crookedest Street", but there are STEEP hills, so we opted to drive instead. Someone mentioned stepping over homeless people on the way to and from the hotel, but we came back really late at night several times, and really didn't experience any of that. In addition, we didn't have any problem with noise, but our room was far away from the road. One thing to keep in mind is that there is tax charged on the room, which was not mentioned when we made our reservations. It was 15% above the quoted rate. We most likely would not have changed our minds about staying had we known, but it would have been good information to have. Overall, we would definitely recommend the Redwood Inn to any of our friends traveling in the San Francisco area.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: DjiC
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here basically because of the great information we got about the attractions, the places to go, the directions , the restaurants, ... The staff is ery friendly and competent. Also, the hotel is located in a very hot spot in the city. You can't go wrong if you think about the staff, tha location, the price, the rooms, ... The four of us will definetly be back here! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, give it a go!!!”
Reviews.Author: stuart2609
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews about reservations not being held, I was a little worried after driving 600 miles from Vegas. When we arrived, we had no problems at all. The staff were more than helpful, giving us a map of the local area, and pointing out which buses/trams to catch to get to the local tourist traps. The room itself was just fine, clean, an ok size, and perfect for the money. The only downside was the amount of noise that came from outside, though, this was more due to the fact that some people have little or no consideration for others staying in the hotel, staying in the car park shouting to each other, and constantly pushing the "lock" button on there car key fob so the horn would keep blaring!!!! The car park is no bigger than a starbucks, if you can't find your car in something that small, you think you ought to be driving at all??? All in all a great place to stay. Fantastic location, within walking distance to most places except Union Square. I would definately recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for what it was, but good location”
Reviews.Author: silvesy
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is quite pricey overall, so we were looking for the best place on a tight budget. The accommodation was clean and basic, but it was in an ideal location(Lombard Street). Be careful when you book as they don't send a receipt or email confirming anything and they don't take the money out until you get there, and since its quite pricey, your holidaying budget might get a hit. Overall the location is the selling point here.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Dave95
Reviews.Content: A friendly and helpful lady checked me in, offered me either a room with a view or a room at the back which was a bit quieter. The room is ok, fairly basic, but has a fridge, TV & free wi-fi. The motel has it's own car park and parking is free. Traffic noise is still audible even in one of the "quieter rooms". They do charge a $50 refundable deposit though. There's no breakfast as such, but they did have some huge doughnuts in reception in the morning - and damn tasty they were as well! It's an ok place, a bit basic, but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: iviolinist
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned about this hotel as it's so close to the Wharf and so cheap. But I needn't have worried. I booked the hotel for $100/night for 8 nights and was told that was the AAA rate for a 1 bed / 2 person room and the best rate they could give it for. (I booked for a friend who came later in the week and they told her to thank me for getting her the very best deal they have to offer.) The room was clean, though small, and I felt safe on the property. (I was on the 3rd floor near the back.) The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. I was in town for a wedding and stayed at a different hotel one night and they let us check out and back in for that night so we didn't have to double pay. Parking was free, there were donuts and muffins for breakfast every day (yummy!) and it was within (a long) walking distance to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf (but Pier 39 is a LONG walk away) and Gharadelli Square. There was a $50 deposit for the key and the remote which we thought was extreme, but it's given back at check-out time. We also returned the remote early and they gave us back $25. If I need to return to the city and need a cheap place to stay, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great S.F. Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthDakotaAFWife
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel to stay at - fantastic location! Within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, Little Italy and great restaurants. The rooms were nice - just what you need. Complimentary donuts and muffins in the morning. On-site parking. Management/staff very nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Don’t Say You Haven’t Been Warned!!!”
Reviews.Author: Twilight010
Reviews.Content: After reading the "good reviews" on Redwood Inn we decided to book for three nights. I am curious if the reviews being written for this place are by people that own shares? This is a terrible place to stay. For starters six lanes of traffic run in front of the building and doesn’t let up as the front clerk told us. The room is old with old furniture and the bedspread looked dirty and grungy, the blanket had cigarette burns and bloodstains. There were two deadbolts and another key lock on the room door and the door looked like it had been broken in a few times. I did not feel safe. I dosed through the traffic with my cloths on and at 6:00 am we got out of dodge. As far as location, it is a 14+block walk to Pier 39, if you don’t mind the long walk back on dark streets and stepping over homeless people then this is the place for you. On the positive side, they were willing to give us a two night refund, they offer free parking and they serve donuts for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the price goes up! NO AAA discount!”
Reviews.Author: Jacquie420
Reviews.Content: While the website states one price, this website states a cheaper price, and the motel even says it gives a AAA discount, when I paid they made had a schpel about why the price was higher, and that higher price even was "better than the AAA price". Yeah, right! What a line of (-**-)! This is a budget hotel with free parking and it is clean, but does not offer any extras. I have no complaints in this regard. I wanted a budget place with no frills. It is right in the middle of a lot of fun things to do and see. I loved my stay there and had a great time. But!!! I think they are conning people with the pricing. I paid 135.00 a night for 4 nights. That was for 2 people, 2 beds, 1 car. No extras, no baby stuff, no extra cars. There are NO $84.00 rooms at this motel! Just be aware! And as far as a AAA discount, forget it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: denmark75693348
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days and we enjoyed our stay in Redwood Inn. The room is comfortable and the service is excellence. The staffs have helped us a lot. The location is convenience. We recommend this motel to our friends who visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Specific Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: kmanshouse
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my family of five, kids 11, 11, and 8. Room had 2 double beds and a rollaway. Pros = Value, we got this room at $150/night with free parking and doughnuts/muffins in the office. Microwave, frig, large room on the corner (room 49) of the top floor. For 5 people, in this city, this was pretty cheap, given what I was finding. The front desk woman was helpful. There was an elevator, albeit very slow, that really helped with all our bags. Bathroom was small, but adequate - overall the room was spacious. Neutral = Location was safe, and not too far from Ghirardelli Square - maybe 7-8 blocks? But with kids, it's not totally ideal - next time I would probably stay at Union Square, where there is a cable car turnabout right there. You cant catch the cars near the hotel, according to the desk. But that said, it was a reasonable walk to Ghirardelli and not that bad to the Wharf. The cleanliness of the room was fine - it wasn't blowing me away, but it wasn't dingy either. It is definitely a budget hotel, and if I weren't in the heart of SF, I would not have considered this as big a bargain. Cons = For those who don't like entering your room from the outdoors (motel style), this isn't for you. My wife doesn't like that - so that was a negative. We were reluctant to open the windows, because it just opens to the catwalk outside where people are walking. There was a sign outside the office that I didn't see until we left that said something about a health issue regarding asbestos. WTF? Since we were leaving I decided not to think about it. Also, the cable had pretty limited channels. There was HBO but no ESPN. Overall this was a good value in a decent location with free parking, which is huge. I might stay here again if I were alone or with buddies, but with my family I would probably look for something a bit closer to the cable car turnabouts or where I was closer to the Wharf or Union Square - if I could afford it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cfisch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Redwood Inn from 6/27/08-6/30/08. The rooms were very clean, and spacious. The hotel is in a quieter section of the city, so you can count on getting a good nights rest after spending the day taking in the sights. The price is excellent for S.F. The hotels employees were very informative and eager to help. The hotel location is close to everything. We were able to walk to Fisherman's Warf, the financial district, etc. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, nice service, very cheap!”
Reviews.Author: bobapanbeers
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from May 4th to May 7th 2008. At 80 $ a night on Lombard St, we thought il was a bargain. The room was clean and bug free. Also, they gave us a room with a full kitchen for the price of a regular room, that was nice even if we didn't need it. The morning breakfast consisted of one donut or one muffin. Not much but it was fresh and surprisingly good. The location is just great: it's close to the Golden Gate Bridge and the Fisherman's Wharf but if you really want to save time while visiting SF I would suggest getting a MUNI passport, it saved us time and money (parking is very expensive in SF). The best part of our stay at the Redwood Inn was the roof. It has a beautiful view of the city. You can climb up there using the stairs, it's absolutly wonderful. We will stay there again next time we go to SF! (also, I was short 1 dime for the coke dispenser and the front desk gave one to me, that's got to be worth something!)

Reviews.Title: “Great value and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: mdufresne25
Reviews.Content: First of all, I stayed for 7 nights, so they gave me a $65/night rate. I was thinking it might be tiny and dirty because of the price, but it was one of the cleanest hotels I have stayed at, regardless of how many star ratings the others have. The room was quite large, with a table and chairs, microwave, and fridge in the room. The bed was a little hard, but I didn't mind too much. I never had the doughnuts in the morning, but they were in the lobby every morning. This hotel is a 10 minute walk to just about anything in the Fisherman's Wharf, and has several main bus routes within 2-3 minutes walking time. If I ever make it back to San Francisco, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, free parking”
Reviews.Author: niloc-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights in late January 2008. No compaints + Price $75 Night for 2 Queen Bed Room with fridge/micro Free parking (don't know if there's enough room if hotel is fully booked) Clean but old TV had so many channels Elevator - No coffee in lobby (room only..I don't use those machines in any hotel) No shampoo 25c for a 1800 call Deposit for TV remote. We didn't think much of the place we were recommended to for breakfast. The second day we drove west along Lombard and had a really good breakfast at Baywatch Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: rocky222
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally situated and given its price, one can hardly complain. We booked a queen bed and the room was a fairly large size. Bathroom wasn't too bad although there were no places to really hang towels. Our room also faced the main street (Lombard) which was quite noisy throughout the morning and day. However, I didn't really notice the street noise late at night when heading to bed. I stayed for 3 nights and would definitely consider staying here again if I'm ever in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliness is not Extinct”
Reviews.Author: ClayC
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for our 4 night stay in SF. Just to say that when we arrived in SF, a huge convention was in town and it was our final hope after 6 different hotels before heading out of town. Every single hotel we tried had over inflated prices - the Holiday Inn wanted 379 a night! Even the price of the less attractive hotel across the road was $240 for a double May, the owner, was wonderful and she was surprised at my surprise that the rate was still extremely reasonable despite the high prices of the other hotels. The rooms where extremely clean, the location with half hour walk of everything and of course, the free parking made it much easier than our other stays in the States. On top of all of this, the bubble-brain that i am left my wallet and they happily sent it back to Australia, arriving a week after we left Would definetly recommend it, if only on the fact that they didn't attempt to rip us off like everyone else tried

Reviews.Title: “Great find!!”
Reviews.Author: dl131
Reviews.Content: After going hotel to hotel looking for a room, we found this one!!! Hotel room was very clean, had cable tv, refrigerator, and coffee maker. Price was very reasonable for the area - and included parking!!! Lobby person who greeted us was very helpful and friendly. She took time in giving us a map and pointing out the attractions we shouldn't miss in the area. They had donuts and coffee in the lobby in the mornings. If I ever go back to San Francisco, will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: LiesbethB
Reviews.Content: Had a really pleasant stay at the redwood in .. very friendly staff... good price...clean and comfortable rooms .. tv, microwave and fridge, comfortable bathroom... near fisherman's wharf and public transport... safe area ! what can i say .. I love this city now and would certainly suggest this hotel to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Content: From the UK I have booked this hotel for many visits and have always found it first class. For those wishing to be close to the Fishermans Wharf area you would have a job to find better in the price range. Car parking OK, security seems to be fine. Ive walked around to some small hours in the morning and have never had problems. C J Marsden, Dawlish. UK

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tahoedreamer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel...please do yourself a favor and stay away.....the room smelled bad...the bathroom was not clean, the sheets were dirty, and to top off everything else....there was no hot water in the am for a shower..this was not just my room, but, the entire hotel... PLEASE STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and peaceful stay”
Reviews.Author: majooo
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by accident, but it was really good luck. For very low price they offer amazing housekeeping service, also all staff is very friendly and always willing to help 24 hours a day. It's close to the main SF atractions and we really enjoyed our stay in here and can only recommend...

Reviews.Title: “be sure to book ahead!”
Reviews.Author: calamark
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to San Francisco we were very fortunate to have done our homework and stayed at the Redwood Inn. The inn is spotless and staffed by the warmest and most helpful and courteous staff. Located on historic Lombard Street near the famous "zig-zag" it is ideal for getting out and around to all that San Francisco has to offer. If you are looking for a safe, clean and comfortable place to stay while visiting SF that provides secure parking for your car ...and is reasonably priced ...I would recommend the Redwood Inn without the slightest hesitation! Thanks to Yan and May for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: pigreca
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in the Redwood Inn hotel in Lombard street for 2 nights with a friend of mine. The hotel was a great choice. The room rate, under the avarage of its competitors, worth completly the more-than-good room, the free car parking, the wireless connection and some tasty donuts for breakfast. All the staff was really friendly and I had not any sort of problems. Futhermore, the hotel was really close to all and a block distant from the bus stop. We were able to walk to North Beach area and then down to the waterfront. I suggest the Redwood Inn hotel to all are looking for a good accomodation for a reasonable price in the center of San Franciso.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Booking in Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kfrench
Reviews.Content: My finace and I went to visit freinds on Saturday afternoon in the Marina District. As many of you know it is extremely difficult to find a room on such late notice. I first called and was told they were booked (even though I drove by and saw the vacancy sign). I asked my fiance to go in and check (literally 2 minutes later) and they did have a room for us (I do reliaze they reserve for walk-ins, but I had told her I was just around the corner). I have never had them give you a TV remote with the key and take a $50 deposite- she kept asking for cash (in an AAA 3-star), but hey, that's fine. The bathroom was the cleanest part of the hotel (just remodeled). The carpet and furniture had very visible stains and appeared to be well over a decade in age. Check out was 11 am on Sunday and when I asked for a noon check out I was told I would be charged another nights rate if we were not checked out by 11:30 am. Overall it was not a comfortable stay, although the location was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you go to san francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Godsom
Reviews.Content: we had such a good time here during our stay in this wonderful city and motel! it's in a perfect location and the rooms have all the facilities. also there is good breakfast in the morning and internet is free and works in its way! Everyday they clean your room and make your stay comfortable. There is a free parking if you are driving a car. Go to redwood inn!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: danubear
Reviews.Content: I found this nice place by chance and I'm very happy with it. They are so helpful with everything, the room is very comfortable and clean (and no bad smell!), and btw. it's a very good location with a beautiful sight. And last but not least the WiFi internet access is perfect. Prices are ok. So I really recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in San Francisco & Redwood Inn”
Reviews.Author: ElPana23
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in the Redwood Inn for three days and we enjoyed very much our stay in the Redwood Inn. The location is very great which is close to the attaction points. The staff are very good and friendly. The service and the room rate are excellent. We wil come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Redwood Inn”
Reviews.Author: 1954DC0209
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Redwood Inn in San Francisco from May 10th to the 13th really enjoyed my stay.The room was clean and roomy had a coffee-maker and a small refrig for drinks or anything that you want. The room was cleaned every day and the motel staff was very helpful with directions and places to eat. very affordable at 80.00 a night and only about 10 blocks to Fisherman's wharf. the motel is at 1530 Lombard Street and two or three blocks from the crookest street in the world Would recommend the Redwood Inn to anyone traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel_Arg
Reviews.Content: Our stay there was really good! The staff was very kind and helpfull. They convinced us to stay there and we do not regreet about the decisión. The price was very good. It is located just 600 meters of girardeli square and fisherman warf, so we walked there. Even at night, the way to the hotel was quite, lighty and safe! On the other hand, we could find bus stops for where ever place we wanted to go! The rooms were nice, clean and they had a fridge. I think other people got rooms with microwave! The combination of price, location and kindness of the staff definitely make our vacations in SFO a great time to remember!

Reviews.Title: “A very welcoming stay.”
Reviews.Author: eidojs
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the heart of San Francisco. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. They went out of their way to ensure our stay was as pleasant as possible, providing maps and recommendations for eating out. The rooms are a good size, with plenty of space for luggage etc. Very Good facilities, all that you require ( bathroom with good shower, TV, fridge ). Within easy reach of all tourist attractions within the city. and only a 5 minute drive/taxi ride from bustling city centre full of good restaurants and bars and all your shopping needs. Excellent value for money, and highly recommended to anyone planning on staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Milkie
Reviews.Content: On our trip to California me and my boy-friend stayed for four nights at the Redwood Inn on Lombard Street. The location was just perfect for us since we did not need our rental car anymore (even though parking is free at the Redwood Inn) and we could do the sight-seeing by walking around or using the buses. The room was nice and clean, nothing special but everything needed was in it. The staff is very very friendly and very helpful with everything. Thanks again! We enjoyed our stay and recommend this place. :-) Angela & Marc from Munich/Germany

Reviews.Title: “very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: bob75
Reviews.Content: I spent there one night, sept 02, with my wife, but I realised just few weeks later what we were done. I was told that I'd have been charged 40$ more for caution and I'll have got my money back at the checking out, after giving back the room's key. I was than charged 159 $ at the checking in. The day after, at the checking out, I was given a new receipt for 120$ and I supposed everything was correct. When I've finally received the credit card account beginning this month, I find out that I've been charged 159$, instead of 120$. I tried to get a solution by phone several times, but I couldn't. I've also written 3 emails to the Director, but I've never got a reply with some explanation ! very bad story, Roberto Ranalli, Italy

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Add Up”
Reviews.Author: SLOMIKE
Reviews.Content: This place reminded me of Motel 6, circa 1970. The family seemed earnest. The property was still functional. The bath was ok. We were right on Lombard. Noisy, creepy, (I hope) clean. But, it had the ambiance and location of house label cream cheese. I will next pay the $$$ to be a little pampered in this expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Good with some reservations”
Reviews.Author: MsSand
Reviews.Content: A small family run hotel. The hotel was old and the furnishings were nothing special. It reminded us of a Motel Six. The fridge was nice and came in very handy. The breakfast consisted of one doguhnut or muffin which was handed to you each morning by the person behind the desk. There was a coffee pot in the room. We walked to Ghiradelli Square and Union Square, both about six or eight blocks away. There are a couple of inexpensive breakfast places nearby. The area was good and safe in general. It was a bargain rate hotel in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place great stay .”
Reviews.Author: jeffie
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay close to many things easy walk to fishermans wharf.cable car and more Will be back..

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for the main tourist sites.”
Reviews.Author: Coventry-Bob
Reviews.Content: On the strength of reviews on TripAdvsor we booked this hotel and we were not let down. A good location for all the main tourist spots. Good rooms - spotlessly clean and we even had a small kitchen to make snacks. Ample parking - we left the car for three days while we walked around SF. The staff were very friendly - ask for May who will be very helpful. Being Brits we were not too keen on the do nuts or muffins but hey there are great coffee bars and cafes in the vicinity. If you are visiting SF give them a try - telephone bookings only unfortunately but we certainly had no problems. We would definitely head straight for the Redwood Hotel if we return to SF....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: cpotts2tbredu
Reviews.Content: We strictly booked the Redwood Inn on faith of the reviews from Tripadvisor. We were a little leary at first because the hotel has no website, which made me very nervous. Believe me, we were not disappointed at all. The hotel was very clean and the staff very friendly (always smiling) and they were always helpful. They gave us very good recommendations on resturants. They helped us to book tours and followed up to make sure our bus would pick us up without us asking them to. They were like family when we returned and wanted to know if we enjoyed our tour. The hotel is within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, markets, gas, and resturants. There were also some laundramats close by, if needed. I would highly recommend this hotel and if given the opportunity to go back to San Francisco I will not stay anywhere but at the Redwood Inn. Thanks to Tripadvisor and the Redwood Inn it was the best vacation I have ever had. K and C from Tennessee

Reviews.Title: “Adeguate”
Reviews.Author: OffTtoSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: This location was a good budget motel as the price was good. The staff were very, very helpful and went out of their way to get information for us whenever asked. The rooms were clean but definately not modern. They could do with an update. And the lack of shampoo was not good the first morning as we didn't take shampoo with us. I would stay here again if I couldn't afford better. The location was close enough to the wharf - just about a 10 - 15 minute walk - good exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Good motel to stay”
Reviews.Author: chillout
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights and it was quite good. Location is quite good and it's in a quite safe neighborhood. My room was away from the road so it was very quiet and also clean. I stayed a couple of other motels in California for similar price and this one was the best. Shame they don't have a website for online booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DoubleE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Redwood Inn mid July for two nights. This place is great if you are in town to tour and see the area.Clean rooms, good area, felt safe day and night walking.This is not a five star, but with free parking and clean, safe rooms, I have no complaints. Buy a muni pass, and ride local transit for very low price.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Teesa
Reviews.Content: I gave this place four stars because the size of the room was large. This place is a standard motel. But clean and comfortable. Be sure to ask for a room in the back as Lombard st. is very busy, even into the late hrs of the night. Mai at the front desk was just wonderful! She helped us out so much with directions and suggestions. You can take the stairs to the roof and see part of the Golden Gate Bridge. This location is away from Union square and fisherman's wharf, but only a short busride. They have free parking but the parking lot is very tight. Thank goodness we ditched the car the first night back in SF. All rooms are non smoking and they do not allow pets. However,There is a doggie day care down the street. As far as accomodations, the room has a/c, a nice size refrigerator, coffee maker,tv, but no alarm clock. (I found that odd.) Free internet, and HBO. They do not provide toiletries like shampoo or conditoner. That was no biggie to us since we always pack our own anyway. One thing that did irk me is, they never bothered to throw away the tiny sliver of soap that was now half the size (and we all know how BIG those motel soaps are..lol) that we used to wash our hands with by the sink. You would think they would have replaced that. We diddnt have breakfast there so I cant comment on the continental breakfast. I really have no complaints about the motel. It served our needs as a family of four. We diddnt stay in the room much anyway. Would I stay here again? Probably. But first I would like to try some other places in San Francisco. This place is good for families. Safe neighborhood, My husband and I walked to Walgreens at 11:30pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: mtzirkle
Reviews.Content: July 2006 My wife and I spent three nights at the Redwood Inn in San Francisco. We arrived in SF very late after driving all day. We called the hotel and they stayed on the cell phone with me and guided me to their front door. They even offered to park the car for us. The staff was pleasant beyond belief. They are always at the front desk and encourage you to call if you have any problems. The room was clean, in a convenient location, and we didn't have any problems. I would suggest that they put some security devices on the inside of the room doors. Overall a great deal, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I was underwhelmed...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in the middle of a road trip from the Oregon coast to Anaheim. We thought staying a night in San Francisco would be exciting. I was looking for a moderately priced hotel that would accomodate four people comfortably. I found the Redwood Inn while searching the internet for a hotel that would meet my needs, and reserved a room based solely on the reviews of other guests. Making the reservation was a challenge because it does not have a website or published e-mail address. There was no way to make my reservation online. Also, there were no pictures of the hotel on the internet. When we arrived in San Francisco, after 6 hours of driving, we found the hotel relatively easily. It's a little tricky with the rules on Lombard street. While the front office staff were friendly and helpful, to the point of offering concierge services for tourists, we were a little dismayed at being charged a $50 deposit and assigned a remote for the tv in our room. The one elevator on the property is small and confusing to operate, but we made our way to our room and washed up before walking several blocks down to Fishermans Wharf. The room was adequate, but nothing special. We had a double queen bed room, with a table & chairs and a small refrigerator. The other amenities of the hotel included free parking and pastries for breakfast. There is also a small observation deck on the roof. Overall the hotel served its purpose, but I think it's seen better days. I definitely would not recommend the room to a family of four.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My traveling companion and I spent $110 per night for 3 nights, and this was for 2 queen beds. I must say, this is the best bargain I've ever had in San Francisco - and I have gone there several times over the past 14 years. First of all, the staff are very friendly and polite. On the first day I got there, I noticed that one of the light bulbs in the bathroom was burned out, so I notified the front desk. Not more than one minute later, one of the maids was knocking on our door to rectify the situation. Now, this is my idea of prompt customer service, if it still exists anywhere! Without asking them, we were given an upper floor room towards the back, away from the traffic noise in the front. I slept very comfortably all 3 nights I was there. The hotel room itself was kept very immaculate by the maids. Also, a great plus for the room was the mini-fridge, as mentioned by the past reviewers. The reason why this is convenient is because some of you may not want to have their free donuts and small muffins for breakfast (this limited choice is their only downside), and may opt instead to buy stuff like yogurt or juice. My friend and I walked to Fisherman's Wharf with no problems. The neighborhood seems nice and quiet, safe enough to walk around at night. If you're game for an uphill walk, you can even make it to the crooked street to take pictures. (I would avoid driving to the crooked street by car in the late afternoon or evenings, because there always seems to be an endless line of cars stretching for blocks). I took the advice of one of the past reviewers and took in the amazing views at the rooftop of the hotel. I was so impressed! Overall, this is quite a gem of a hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of pluses here”
Reviews.Author: Aibutiej
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Redwood Inn. The good points: -the location. It was a little off the beaten path so in general was quieter than, say the Union Square area, yet it close to Van Ness Ave. where you can catch a bus to Fisherman's Wharf or to Market St. We actually walked from this hotel to Pier 39 and found it to be a pleasant walk. Also there were no homeless people as there were near hotels in other areas. -the room. It was a good size and the beds were comfortable. It was also very clean, as was the bathroom. -the extras. The room had a mini-fridge, which came in handy when we decided to buy milk and cereal at the gas station food mart down the street. Also, it had A/C. I know people say that it doesn't get hot in SF, but when we were there it was quite sunny. The rooms would get stuffy so we appreciated being able to cool them down with the A/C. -free parking. After spending a few days walking and using MUNI, we spontaneously decided to rent a car to drive over the Golden Gate Bridge and see other areas. It was nice to know that we could park for free at the Inn. -the elevator. Although we had a room at the fourth floor at this exterior hall motor inn, we had no trouble getting our luggage up there because of the elevator. The only negative was the Internet service (which is free). My husband needed to check e-mails and found the connection rather slow. Also, he would lose the connection if we turned on the TV. If you need Internet, we advise you to ask for a room near the front where the wireless connection is better. However, we expect that many vacation travelers would not need the Internet so much, in which case this would be a good hotel choice. (It isn't a business hotel, after all). As I said, overall we were happy with it and would stay here again if ever we needed a downtown SF hotel again. We paid $100 for a one queen-bed room and felt it to be a good value.

HotelInfo.Name: Redwood Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1530 Lombard Street, San Francisco, CA 94123
